page.title: 18Farming and Quarrying
page.content: Much of the study area is used for farming. A large part of the Country Park is leased to local farmers where 'conservation' farming is undertaken; to encourage the development of hay meadows, with associated flora and fauna. Parts are also grazed or used for cereal crops. Further west grazing, and cereal crops are also the major form of farming. The animals grazed include goats, sheep, beef cattle and heifers, ponies and horses. There are many spoil heaps which are left to grow wild, remains of quarries. Also two small stone quarries exist in the study area, where extraction of Purbeck stone continues. Two farms are within this block,on one a youth camp is sited annually each summer.
